#Text=Hakuba
#Text=Hakuba ( 白馬村 Hakuba-mura ) , is a skiing resort in Nagano Prefecture , in the Chubu district of Japan .
#Text=The name Hakuba which means white horse was derived by the shape of a horse of snow on the mountain side during spring time .
#Text=History shows traders following the famous Salt Road from the Japan Sea to Matsumoto who would stop in the Hakuba valley overnight to rest .
#Text=By train
#Text=Hakuba is a stop on the JR Oito Line .
#Text=From Shinjuku in Tokyo , there is one daily Super Azusa limited express service that runs to Hakuba .
#Text=The ride takes 3 hours , 45 minutes and costs ¥ 8070 each way .
#Text=As of November 2009 , the outbound service leaves at 07:30 , and the inbound service ( to Shinjuku ) departs from Hakuba at 14:57 .
#Text=There is also an additional Azusa service on certain dates , making the run to Hakuba in about 4 hours .
#Text=Otherwise , you will have to take an Azusa or Super Azusa to Matsumoto and take one ( possibly two ) Oito Line local trains , increasing the journey to 4 1/2 hours .
#Text=The fastest route from Tokyo is by Shinkansen ( bullet train ) from Tokyo Station to Nagano : 105min . /8,170yen .
#Text=Then by bus from Nagano to Hakuba 65min . /1,500yen .
#Text=Trains run every half hour or so , buses every hour .
#Text=Note that the last bus from Nagano Station to Hakuba is 8:30PM .
#Text=This whole trip takes just over 2.5 hours , 9,700yen one way .
#Text=These trips are useful for Japan Rail Pass holders , or else it is probably cheaper to take the bus .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Hakuba-Shinjuku Express ( 高速バス白馬・安曇野－新宿線 ) .

column3: 高速バス白馬・安曇野－新宿線

column1: #Text=Every two or three hours. .
#Text=Buses run from Shinjuku and stop at several places in the Hakuba region .
#Text=The trip takes around 4 and a half hours
#Text=¥ 8500 round-trip for adults , half off for children .
#Text=Nagano-Hakuba Express ( 特急バス長野－白馬線 ) .
#Text=Every hour during ski season. .
#Text=Buses from Nagano to Hakuba .
#Text=The journey takes just over an hour .
#Text=¥ 1400 for adults , ¥ 700 for children .
#Text=Nagano Snow Shuttle , ☏ +81 261-75-5360 .
#Text=Operates in the winter season. .
#Text=Daily service from Narita Airport to Hakuba .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Outside of the winter months , there are plenty of bike trails and walking paths to get around the area .
#Text=Many hostels have bike rental which helps if you are a little bit outside of Hakuba proper .
#Text=If you are based around Kamishiro station , you are on the main rail line and road so a trip into Hakuba proper is only five minutes by JR or by Bus .
#Text=The Shuttle Bus " Genki-Go " runs from December through March in the evenings from 17:00 .
#Text=Three lines run throughout Hakuba for 300yen a ride .
#Text=During the Green Season
#Text=Near Hakuba , during the green season ( i.e. spring , summer & autumn ) , there are three freshwater lakes that are so clean that you can swim in them .
#Text=In order from south to north , they are called Aoki-ko , Nakazuna-ko , and Kizaki-ko .
#Text=The use of engines and outboard motors is banned on Aoki-ko , making it the quietest and nicest of the three .
#Text=Popular activities include boating , sport fishing , and windsurfing .
#Text=Nakazuna-ko is very small and only really attracts fishermen .
#Text=Kizaki-ko is the most developed , and since engines are allowed , sports like wakeboarding are popular .
#Text=During the summer , most of the ski resorts operate some of their lifts to allow access to higher elevations .
#Text=At Hakuba 47 and Aokiko ( in nearby Omachi ) , the lifts allow access for mountain biking .
#Text=Hiking or simply enjoying the views are popular at Happo , Goryu and Tsugaike .
#Text=Above Happo , an easy trail extends for 40 minutes to a small pond in which the local alpine peaks are reflected .
#Text=A couple of hours further up the trail lies the peak of Mt . Karamatsu on the main ridge of the North Alps .
#Text=The top ski run at Goryu becomes an alpine garden in summer and another trail leads further upward to a viewpoint ( around 50 minutes ) or the peak of Mt . Goryu itself ( around four hours ) .
#Text=Above Tsugaike , a further ropeway takes you to a wetland that is designated as a national park .
#Text=A trail from here takes you up to Mt . Shirouma , after which Hakuba is named .
#Text=Shirouma and Hakuba are different readings of the kanji for " white horse " .
#Text=The smaller ski field of Iwatake uses its pistes to grow thousands of lilies in summer and also has a dry ski slope if you 're desperate for turns .
#Text=Like all mountain areas in Japan , temperatures in Hakuba stay much cooler than in the cities on Japan 's Pacific coast .
#Text=That alone makes it worthy of a visit .

#Text=Hakuba , located in Nagano Prefecture , equally central to Osaka , Nagoya and Tokyo and nestled at the base of the Northern Japan Alps is towered over by the Three Peaks which provide a stunning backdrop year round .
#Text=While Hakuba is world famous for it 's snow and boasts more than 10 resorts , the green season offers plenty to those craving an escape from the confines of Japan in general .
#Text=Do
#Text=Whether you 're a snowboarder or skier , beginner or pro , with seven ski resorts in the area you should n't have problems finding a run to suit your style .
#Text=Hakuba 47 Winter Sports Park ( Hakuba 47 ウインタースポーツパーク ) , 24196-47 Kamishiro , ☏ +81 261-75-3533 .

column3: ウインタースポーツパーク

column1: #Text=Open 8.30AM to 4.30PM daily , Dec-May approx.
#Text=With an annual snowfall of over 10m , Hakuba 47 offers 23 name runs , from beginner to advanced , as well as snowshoe and snowmobile tours .
#Text=Private lessons for skiers or snowboarders are available in English and they rent basic equipment too .
#Text=Hakuba Happo-one ( 白馬八方尾根スキー場 ) , 5713 Hokujo , ☏ +81 261-72-2715 .

column3: 白馬八方尾根スキー場

column1: #Text=Hakuba Happo-one is an extremely popular ski resort in Nagano Prefecture .
#Text=Kick off your winter snow sports adventures in the heart of Japan .
#Text=Happo-one is located in a pure natural setting in the Northern Japanese Alps where hot springs flow abundantly in this extensive mountainous region .
#Text=The ski runs are varied ranging from beginner level to Olympic challenging long course and downhill runs ( Nagano Olympic 1998 ) .
#Text=13 courses and 23 lifts with the longest run 8000m .
#Text=There is much to be experienced in Happo area .
#Text=Not only a winter sports resort Happo runs all year round and experiences peak visitor times during the summer in July and August .
#Text=Outdoor sports lovers should come to Happo to soak up the wonderful views , the fresh clean air and enjoy the local food and wine which is highly recommended .
#Text=With this and Happo 's friendly and polite customer service
#Text=the visitor will not be disappointed .
#Text=Please come and experience Happo-one !
#Text=Click on our English Home Page above for further information and links .
#Text=There are plenty of onsen ( hot spring baths ) in the Hakuba area , perfect for soaking away the aches and pains of a day on the slopes .
#Text=Do n't forget to wash off before you enter the water .
#Text=Juro No Yu ( 十郎の湯 ) ( A ten minute walk from Kamishiro Station . ) , ☏ +81 261-71-8160 .
#Text=Dec-Mar 24h , Apr-Nov 10AM-10PM , closed 2nd Tu each month .
#Text=Enjoy the piping hot mineral waters in the inside and outside baths while looking out over the snow capped mountains .
#Text=When your skin starts shrivelling up , dry off and head to the lounge to kick back on the tatami and watch TV or dig into a steaming bowl of tempura soba .
#Text=Sauna , lockers provided .
#Text=Adults ¥ 500 , children ¥ 400 .
#Text=Tenjin No Yu ( 天神の湯 ) ( A 15 minute walk from Hakuba Station . ) , ☏ +81 261-72-3450 .
#Text=W - M 9AM-10PM .
#Text=Recommended by locals for its healing waters , Tenjin No-Yu offers great views of the mountains from both indoor and outdoor baths .
#Text=Lockers available .
